chapter.fullItemName: Symptoms suggestive of lung and pleural cancers
chapter.htmlHeader: Symptoms suggestive of lung and pleural cancers
chapter.htmlStringContent:
Table 2. Symptoms suggestive of lung and pleural cancers.

SymptomPossible cancerReferral recommendation
Deep vein thrombosisSeveral, including urogenital, breast, colorectal, or lung

Carry out an assessment for additional symptoms, signs, or findings that may help to clarify which cancer is most likely

Consider urgent investigation or a suspected cancer pathway referral (for an appointment within 2 weeks)

Appetite loss (unexplained)Several, including lung, oesophageal, stomach, colorectal, pancreatic, bladder, or renal

Carry out an assessment for additional symptoms, signs, or findings that may help to clarify which cancer is most likely

Offer urgent investigation or a suspected cancer pathway referral (for an appointment within 2 weeks)

Appetite loss (unexplained), age 40 years and over, ever smokedLung or mesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Appetite loss (unexplained), age 40 years and over, exposed to asbestosMesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Appetite loss (unexplained) with cough or fatigue or shortness of breath or chest pain or weight loss (unexplained), age 40 years and overLung or mesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Chest infection (persistent or recurrent), age 40 years and overLungConsider an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Chest pain (unexplained), age 40 years and over, ever smokedLung or mesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Chest pain (unexplained), age 40 years and over, exposed to asbestosMesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Chest pain (unexplained) with cough or fatigue or shortness of breath or weight loss or appetite loss (unexplained), age 40 years and overLung or mesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Chest signs consistent with lung cancer, age 40 years and overLungConsider an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Chest signs compatible with pleural disease, age 40 years and overMesotheliomaConsider an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Cough (unexplained), age 40 years and over, ever smokedLung or mesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Cough (unexplained), age 40 years and over, exposed to asbestosMesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Cough (unexplained) with fatigue or shortness of breath or chest pain or weight loss or appetite loss (unexplained), age 40 years and overLung or mesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Fatigue (unexplained), age 40 years and over, ever smokedLung or mesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Fatigue (unexplained), age 40 years and over, exposed to asbestosMesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Fatigue with cough or shortness of breath or chest pain or weight loss or appetite loss (unexplained), age 40 years and overLung or mesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Finger clubbing, age 40 years and overLung or mesotheliomaConsider an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Haemoptysis (unexplained), age 40 years and overLungRefer people using a suspected cancer pathway referral (for an appointment within 2 weeks)
Lymphadenopathy (supraclavicular or persistent cervical), age 40 years and overLungConsider an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Shortness of breath (unexplained), age 40 years and over, ever smokedLung or mesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Shortness of breath (unexplained), age 40 years and over, and exposed to asbestosMesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Shortness of breath with cough or fatigue or chest pain or weight loss or appetite loss (unexplained), age 40 years and overLung or mesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Weight loss (unexplained)Several, including colorectal, gastro-oesophageal, lung, prostate, pancreatic, or urological cancer

Carry out an assessment for additional symptoms, signs, or findings that may help to clarify which cancer is most likely

Offer urgent investigation or a suspected cancer pathway referral (for an appointment within 2 weeks)

Weight loss (unexplained), age 40 years and over, ever smokedLung or mesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Weight loss (unexplained), 40 years and over, exposed to asbestosMesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Weight loss with cough or fatigue or shortness of breath or chest pain or appetite loss (unexplained), age 40 years and over, never smokedLung or mesotheliomaOffer an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Thrombocytosis, age 40 years and overLungConsider an urgent chest X-ray (to be performed within 2 weeks)
Chest X-ray suggests lung cancerLungRefer people using a suspected cancer pathway referral (for an appointment within 2 weeks)
Chest X-ray suggests mesotheliomaMesotheliomaRefer people using a suspected cancer pathway referral (for an appointment within 2 weeks)
Data from: [NICE, 2015]
